## Theory
The same issue in JSON with files that are not plain happens in XML files. In the mapping the values of the XML are referenced using [XML Path language](https://xpath.playground.fontoxml.com/). 
```xml
<element att=12>
	<param>33</param>
	<child>
		<nestedParam>44</nestedParam> 
	</child>
</element>
```
For the sample XML to access the value of ***param*** in RML the mapping should specify **"param"**, instead to access ***nestedParam*** the mapping should specify **"child/nestedParam"**.  In the case of attributes, the mapping must use **"@att"**.
## Hands-on
### Task
Complete the mapping below for generating triplets containing the names and the surfaces.
### XML file content
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<locations>
	<place>
		<features>
			<population>
				<amount>1,812</amount>
				<date>2018</date>
			</population>
			<surface>
				<units>Km2</units>
				<value>90.16</value>
			</surface>
		</features>
		<location>
			<latitude>44.9625428</latitude>
			<longitude>-74.4168577</longitude>
		</location>
		<name>Oneonta</name>
	</place>
	...
</locations>
```
